amendment.description: To suspend, for 2 years, any Environmental Protection Agency enforcement of greenhouse gas regulations, to exempt American agriculture from greenhouse gas regulations, and to increase the number of companies eligible to participate in the successful Advanced Energy Manufacturing Tax Credit Program.

vote.text: Amendment SA 277, under the order of 4/5/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 7 - 93. Record Vote Number: 52.

action.text: Amendment SA 277 proposed by Senator Landrieu for Senator Stabenow. (consideration: CR S2155-2157, S2178; text: CR S2155-2156) To suspend, for 2 years, any Environmental Protection Agency enforcement of greenhouse gas regulations, to exempt American agriculture from greenhouse gas regulations, and to increase the number of companies eligible to participate in the successful Advanced Energy Manufacturing Tax Credit Program.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 277 proposed by Senator Landrieu for Senator Stabenow.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 277, under the order of 4/5/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 7 - 93. Record Vote Number: 52.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 277, under the order of 4/5/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 7 - 93. Record Vote Number: 52.
